properties.title: How To view logging events using Apache log4j Chainsaw

section.name: How To view logging events using Apache log4j Chainsaw
section.p: Apache log4j includes Chainsaw a graphical log viewer.
Chainsaw can either receive and display log events in realtime over the network, or it can load a previously created log file.

Before Chainsaw can display data, one or more receivers must be setup. This is usually done by specifying an xml config file when the program first starts up.
Save one or more of the sample xml config files to your local system and load them when Chainsaw starts.

section.name: Logging via UDP
section.p: log4net can be configured to log messages via UDP in such a way that Chainsaw can receive and display them.

section.name: Chainsaw UDP receiver Configuration
section.p: Chainsaw should be configured to start a UDPReceiver using the following configuration document:
section.source: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?> <!DOCTYPE log4j:configuration SYSTEM "log4j.dtd"> <log4j:configuration xmlns:log4j="http://jakarta.apache.org/log4j/" debug="true"> <plugin name="UDPReceiver" class="org.apache.log4j.net.UDPReceiver"> <param name="Port" value="8080" /> </plugin> </log4j:configuration>
